snippet: In December, employers added just 74,000 jobs, the slowest pace of growth in three years and far below the expectations of many economists who had grown convinced that the market was on a more solid footing.
abstract: Labor Department reports that employers added only 74,000 jobs in December, slowest pace in three years; decline reverses three months of steadily rising hiring that had raised hopes about a labor market turnaround.
lead_paragraph: In December, employers added just 74,000 jobs, the slowest pace of growth in three years and far below the expectations of many economists who had grown convinced that the market was on a more solid footing.

headline.main: Growth in Jobs Slows Sharply to 3-Year Low
headline.print_headline: Growth in Jobs Slows Sharply To 3-Year Low
